review.title: Old ornate hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Charged an unexpected "Urban Fee" of $85.50 onto our card. I said that was wrong but no concern by them. Bathroom tiny and sink partially blocked by a column. The room was clean and bed was very comfy. Only 2 1/2 blocks from Union Square. To the immediate south was the Tenderloin district with homeless people, so keep away from that direction.
review.positiveRemarks: Room was clean, bed comfy and staff was generally helpful. Close to Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: Main thing would be to not surprise guests with the "Urban Fee". I hate hidden charges like this.

review.reviewText: Overall the stay at this location was a pleasant experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Reasonable price and good proximity to the downtown area.
review.locationRemarks: Area around the hotel was a little run down but hotel was kept up nicely.

review.title: run down
review.reviewText: I intended a week stay, but had to leave after the first night because of disappointment.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is central in the union square and everything is near by.

review.title: $500 in unexpected fees.
review.reviewText:
Beds were labeled as queen sized but were barely a full size. Rooms and bathrooms are extremely small and out dated. The hotel is too short to be able to have a nice view. The windows aren't sealed very well at all. We heard CONSTANT screaming and or fights outside of the hotel ALL night EVERY night. I wouldn't say the hotel is in Union Square, I'd say it's more in the Tenderloin area - which is the ghetto. 
When I arrived to the hotel, there were ADDITIONAL charges of $50 per night + $25 per night + another tax/fee percentage. These hidden fees amounted to an additional $500! 
Definitely would not stay at the Serrano again or recommend this hotel to anyone.
Small and outdated. I also tried to go to the gym there, but the parts to the machines were missing. When I asked the staff, that said, "Sorry." Rooms were tiny and no coffee makers in rooms.

review.title: Business trip
review.reviewText: I've stayed at the Serrano for almost 10 years. I liked it better when it was part of the Kempton Group, it seams to be getting less and less polished, a bit run down in fact !  I think this will be my last stay until the rooms are refurbished !

review.title: beautiful hotel downtown near everything
review.reviewText: Loved this hotel. We are from Orange County, just wanted an overnight in San Fran and to visit UC Berkeley where my daughter plans on attending. We were able to get parking directly across the street for $39 overnight so that was nice. The restaurant next to Hotel, Jasper;s was not all that great and expensive and just know it is more a bar not a food place but there are so many restaurants close by and Chinese food delivery to the hotel is always a great thing. The staff were wonderful and helpful and really nice. I loved our room. We got a room w/ double beds that were very comfortable - everything you need is here. We stayed in room 716 and really enjoyed the stay.. Thank you to everyone at The Serrano for a wonderful stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were cozy and beds were so comfortable, great location.
review.locationRemarks: It is located near everything in San Fran.. perfect location

review.title: Didn't live up to rating
review.reviewText: Ok...a bit tired and on the edge of a seedy neighborhood. The rooms are small and the clientele mixed (i.e., business travelers on a budget to a large group of European male tourist pulling a cooler filled with beer asking the lobby attendant if there was a pool).  If you are driving be prepared to pay $50 per day for parking in the lots next to and across from the hotel. Around the corner you can find one for $30. Functional but not relaxing.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
With praise like that—we can’t but help having a great day; thanks for the kind words! They’ve been shared with our team, and we’re already looking forward to having you stay with us again. San Francisco is one of the best places to travel, and our goal is to match it with an exceptional stay. We can’t wait to offer you another 5-star getaway!

review.title: I cannot wait to go back to SF and stay here!
review.reviewText: Cannot say enough good things about the night we stayed here. I have stayed at more expensive "Swanky Named" hotels on Union Square... and now I discovered this gem I will never stay at another location in SF.

review.title: Nice - close to everything
review.reviewText:
Honestly, the only real negative was parking and the "amenities" fee. Parking on site is $58 per night and "amenities" fee is $25 per night. As far as I know I've never drunk $25 worth of coffee in a week... never mind a night but that seemed to be the only "amenity" I was privy to. 
Otherwise, the staff is great, the hotel is beautiful and centrally located to all of the fun touristy things to do. Room was impeccably clean. On site dining was also very good.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Momof5ca, 
The Giants are one of the best reasons to visit San Francisco, and we’re glad to hear you enjoyed AT&T Stadium. We’re listening to your feedback about our updates and your experience at Jasper’s. We’re happy to share that we’re bringing back fan favorites to the restaurant. Whether you see the game at the stadium, or cheer around our big screens, we’d love to welcome you back the next time you have Giants fever!

review.title: Close to AT&T Stadium
review.reviewText:
Not truly a 4 star hotel, due to its age, but it was comfortable.
The restaurant attached to it was subpar. Save your money and eat @ the game.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
Location! Location! Location! When you want to be at the heart of San Francisco, and just steps to Union Square, you’ve come to the right place! We’re thrilled you enjoyed your stay and would love to welcome you back anytime!

review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Good location if you need to stay close to  Union Square.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Gary, 
Congratulations on your twins! We’re thrilled you brought them with you and truly apologize we weren’t  as child-friendly as you needed. We’ve passed your feedback on to Jasper’s about their food options because at Serrano (and Jasper’s) we love to welcome families. We’re already looking forward to having you stay again, and when you do, always know we’d love to do anything we can to accommodate your children too!

review.title: Nice hotel, not for family.
review.reviewText: This was the second stay for me at this hotel.  The first was before having twin baby girls!  Both stays were wonderful and the staff is consistently great.  This hotel offer little for children and while the first level restaurant does have good food, the variety in selection is missing.  I will stay at this hotel again, just not with the kids.  Everything was worth the price, except the cost of parking which is really about supply and demand rather than the hotel "choosing" to charge an large price.
review.negativeRemarks: Amenities for families. (e.g. restaurant menu choices, activities)
review.locationRemarks: Close to most everything except the wharf.  Union square shopping about 4 blocks away!

managementResponses.response:
Hello Rochelle, 
Being walking distance to a Starbucks is a definite must—and Union Square, theater, Chinatown, and more is a bonus! We’re very happy to hear you enjoyed your stay. A warm welcome is waiting if you come back in the city!

review.title: Nice Location
review.reviewText: Close to Union Square. No room service available, but within walking distance to Starbucks, restaurants and shopping. A lot of homeless people around, but still a nice hotel and convenient location.

review.title: Great location.  Staff service needs some work.
review.reviewText:
Overall was happy with stay primarily due to location near Union and overall price.  Biggest concerns were staff and checkin.  I purchased a luxury suite for 3.  When I arrived and they assigned me my room I asked specifically if it was the luxury suite. They said yes.  When I got to the room it didn't seem right.  Went back down and another person said no, that was a smaller room but they ran out and had one out of service.  So rather than telling me the truth they were deceptive.  When I asked how the would compensate for the difference they said they couldn't since I prepaid.  Yeah, right!

Next day they moved us to the proper suite for the next 4 nights and only provided $25 of compensation.  Amazing.

Then issues with housecleaning not cleaning my room when I asked because of a mix up with their enviro program.  Front desk assured me it would be cleaned but after returning to room in late afternoon it still wasn't done.

Finally, rooms are a little worn, but nice.  Biggest complaint is the quality of the mattresses.  Very worn and old and uncomfortable.  And the pullout couch had springs poking out of it.

Location was great.  Price was fair, but I wouldn't stay again
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk service and room quality mainly mattresses
review.locationRemarks: Close to union square. Walked to rest restaurants every night.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
As a four-star hotel, housekeeping is a high priority, and we’re sincerely sorry your room disappointed. We’re in the midst of ongoing improvements and are taking your concerns seriously as we progress with our room updates. Several of our rooms have been beautifully refinished, and we’d love another chance to have you back to show you the true beauty of Serrano Hotel!

review.title: Real old hotel. Stay away !
review.reviewText: Room is really small, outdated  and dirty. I wouldn't seven stay here for free

managementResponses.response:
Hello Suzy, 
“I would stay here again” are some of our favorite words! We truly hope you will! It’s hard to cover San Francisco in a weekend, so we’re glad you had some extra time to explore. (And we’re glad our location made that easy!) Thanks for your feedback about our lobby and bathroom size. We’re happy to share that we’re in the midst of ongoing improvements and we’re definitely taking your feedback into consideration as we continue to improve. Don’t be a stranger; we’d love to have you back soon!

review.title: Decent hotel for the price close to Union Square
review.reviewText: My husband and I spent 4 nights at the Serrano Hotel.  Rooms were pleasant, but the bathroom was pretty small.  The lobby was a bit dark - but overall the hotel had charm and was a reasonable price for SF.  There are more indigents than expected close in the area.  It was very centrally located for shopping and getting on tour buses.  I would stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square.  Plenty of shopping and restaurants nearby.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Chris, 
You must’ve been exhausted getting here at one a.m., and we’re very sorry we didn’t have your reserved room available. Thanks for being understanding! We’re glad to hear our location was a highlight of your stay; having you here was the highlight for us!

review.reviewText: Good location, we checked in at 1 am and they didn't have the room we reserved available, got switched to a smaller room. Otherwise no problems.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
We think our guests are “fantastic” too; thanks for being one of them! Often times people play the most important part of any experience, and we’re thrilled to hear our team treated you right. We’d love to welcome you back for another stay!

review.reviewText: Overall a nice hotel near Union Square.  Staff was fantastic.  Rooms are small but comfortable.

managementResponses.response:
Hello, 
You’re right; just five minutes from our door you have the best of San Francisco: shopping, dining, theaters and more-- and just inside our door, you’ll find some of San Francisco most comfortable beds. (It’s what we call a win-win!) Thanks for sharing your concern about the parking options; we are taking your feedback seriously. It was a pleasure to have you as our guest, and we hope you’ll be back again.

review.title: Nice hotel located in the heart of SF
review.reviewText: Hotel is located in the heart of the city. Great location, but no free parking. Beds were very comfortable. No breakfast available.
review.locationRemarks: Heart of the city. 5 minute walk to good shopping
